org.araneaframework.uilib.support
Class SelectGroup<T>

java.lang.Object
  org.araneaframework.uilib.support.SelectGroup<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
DisplayItemGroup
public class SelectGroup<T>
extends Object
implements Serializable

A group of select items that itself cannot be selected, but can contain child options that can be selected.

A group can be disabled, which also disables access to child-options. Whether disabled or empty groups are rendered, depends on the tag, however, not rendering is more recommended.

This class also provides a contract for hiding the group (OPTGROUP) tag while its child options still get rendered. When the default (empty) constructor is used for instantiating select group or when NO_GROUP is used as the label, the group tag won't be rendered. For convenience, this class also provides method isNoGroup() to check whether group tag should be omitted.

Since:
2.0
Author:
Martti Tamm (martti at araneaframework dot org)
See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

NO_GROUP

public static final String NO_GROUP
The identifier-label used for identifying whether the group is default (no label) and its content must be rendered without OPTGROUP HTML tag.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

SelectGroup

public SelectGroup()
Creates a new select control items "invisible" group with no label. The "invisible" means that the group (OPTGROUP) won't be rendered, but its child-options (OPTION) will be rendered.

See Also:
isNoGroup(), NO_GROUP

SelectGroup

public SelectGroup(String label)
Creates a new select control items group with given label and with no child-options.

Parameters:
label - The label for this group.
See Also:
isNoGroup(), NO_GROUP

SelectGroup

public SelectGroup(String label,
                   List<T> options)
Creates a new select control items group with given label and with given child-options.

Parameters:
label - The label for this group.
options - The options that this group will contain, must not be null.
See Also:
isNoGroup(), NO_GROUP
Method Detail

isNoGroup

public boolean isNoGroup()
Provides whether the content of this group must be rendered without the OPTGROUP HTML tag. The content will still be rendered, unless this group is disabled.

Returns:
A Boolean that is true when the OPTGROUP HTML tag must not be used when rendering this tag.

getLabel

public String getLabel()
Provides the label of this group. Beware that the returned label may be the value of NO_GROUP in which case the group must not be rendered.

Returns:
The label of the group.

setDisabled

public void setDisabled(boolean disabled)
Changes the disabled status of this group.

Changing the status to disabled also disables child options, although the underlying child option object might not know it. Vice versa, all child items may be set to disabled, while the group may be enabled, yet no option can be selected. When group is rendered, this disabled status should be used only on the OPTGROUP element, and group child item disabled status should be used on the OPTION element.

Parameters:
disabled - A Boolean that is true when the group should be set to disabled status, otherwise true.

isDisabled

public boolean isDisabled()
Provides the disabled status of this group.

When the status is set to disabled then child options are also disabled, although the underlying child option objects might not know it. Vice versa, all child items may be set to disabled, while the group may be enabled, yet no option can be selected. When group is rendered, this disabled status should be used only on the OPTGROUP element, and group child item disabled status should be used on the OPTION element.

Returns:
A Boolean that is true when the group is in disabled status, otherwise true.

clear

public SelectGroup<T> clear()
Removes all child options of the group.

Returns:
Reference to the group where all child options were removed.

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Provides whether the group is empty (contains no child option at all).

Returns:
A Boolean that is true when the group contains no child option.

addOption

public SelectGroup<T> addOption(T childOption)
Appends an option to existing child options.

Parameters:
childOption - The option to add, must not be null.
Returns:
Reference to the group where the child option was added.

addOptions

public SelectGroup<T> addOptions(Collection<? extends T> childOptions)
Appends given options to existing child options.

Parameters:
childOptions - The options to add, must not be null.
Returns:
Reference to the group where the options were added.

setOptions

public SelectGroup<T> setOptions(List<T> childOptions)
Sets the child options that this group will contain.

Parameters:
childOptions - The child options that the group must contain, must not be null (use clear() when removing all items is needed).
Returns:
Reference to the group where the options were set.
See Also:
clear()

getOptions

public List<T> getOptions()
Provides select items of this group.

Returns:
An unmodifiable list of all child items belonging to this group.

sort

public void sort(Comparator<T> comparator)
Sorts all the child options as defined by the comparator.

Parameters:
comparator - The comparator used for sorting child options.
